Literature Review: Mild fractionation for more sustainable food ingredients is a crucial approach to reduce the environmental impact of food production. The increasing demand for food and the rising costs of raw materials have led to the development of more resource-efficient processes to produce food ingredients. This review aims to provide an overview of the benefits and challenges of mild fractionation, focusing on its environmental impact and functional properties.
